basic.floral_language:
Echeveria 'Lola'
Floriography: delicate, elegant, cute
Is a hybrid of Echeveria derenbergii and Echeveria lilacina, has a cute appearance, fleshy light green oval leaves with tips arranged in a rosette, surface covered by white powders, in a cool season with abundant sunlight, leaves are more closely arranged and color turns light pink. 
Likes sunshine, has a short dormant period under summer high temperature, place under scattered light. Flowers sometimes, light orange red color.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, light orange red flowers
basic.color: Leaf color light green to gray green, when sunny turning to pale pink

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, dormant in summer under high temperatures, put in places with scattered light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer high temperature
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
